bioghist.p: Thomas Sovereign Gates (1873-1948) was an American investment banker and educator. He was the president of the University of Pennsylvania from 1930 until 1944, and was the father of United States Secretary of Defense Thomas S. Gates, Jr. Born in Philadelphia, Gates was a student at University of Pennsylvania. Prior to his election as university president, Gates had served for ten years as a Trustee of the University and as Chairman of the University of Pennsylvania Fund.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of scrapbooks of newspaper clippings, correspondence, invitations, photographs, and speeches relating to the career of Thomas S. Gates in business and as president and trustee of the University of Pennsylvania. The scrapbooks also includes early family records, such as photographs, school records and an 1835 printed address by Thomas Sovereign. The collection also includes two bound memorials to Gates from the American Philosophical Society and the University of Pennsylvania.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
